document.title: Headstands, Writing, and the Rhetoric of Radical Self-Acceptance
document.abstract: By emphasizing the importance of patient practice as an end in itself, yoga offers a model teaching and learning writing that can help students move forward in a context of self-acceptance and find the sources of their own talents and values.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Geraldine DeLuca is Professor of English at Brooklyn College, CUNY, where she directed both the freshman writing program and the program in writing across the curriculum. She co-edited Dialogue on Writing (Lawrence Erlbaum, 2002). She and her colleague David Forbes recently received an ACLS fellowship to establish a pilot program in the uses of contemplative practice at Brooklyn College that will include yoga classes, content courses with a meditation component, and an ongoing faculty study group. She is working on a memoir called Bensonhurst Sutra.
